intro: Strobilanthes bibracteata, commonly known as the "Firecracker Plant," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble firecrackers, hence its common name. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique floral structure makes it a popular subject in botanical studies and horticultural displays.
